channel.title: The Local Version of a Headcrab?
channel.description:
The other day, I came across information about a specific parasite, called Sacculina, that essentially latches onto certain crabs and rewires them, changing behavior, physical appearance and essential converting the crab in question into a vehicle for the parasite, or zombie. It seems to remind me quite a bit of the behavior of Headcrabs and the way they take over human bodies for their own means of survival (Unless there is a crowbar lying around).
What do you guys think?
[url]https://www.damninteresting.com/body-snatching-barnacles-and-zombie-crabs[/url]
[url]https://boingboing.net/2009/04/16/sacculina-are-pretty.html[/url]
[url]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacculina[/url]
[url]https://www.electroherbalism.com/Naturopathy/MiscAltHealthTopics/Parasites/DoParasitesRule.htm[/url]

item.description:
mattemuse:

“Yo dawg I heard u like headcrabs so we got u a crab that headcrabs a crab so u can get crabs when u get head”

sorry thats the first thought i had about this

Hah.

Sacculina is a genus of barnacles

Sacculina is barnacles

barnacle

Half life is fucking real!

Oh wow, I never even noticed that. Nice catch.

item.title: The Local Version of a Headcrab?
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Nosehole:

That is exactly why I hate insects and arachnids so much.

Everything with no spine and more than 4 limbs needs to die in a very large fire.

My sentiments exactly. KILL THE INVERTEBRATES.
